title: How the fuck do you beat ahri?
body:
3 dashes, poke that goes through minions at full damage, charm and built in sustain.

my mid laners are/were velkoz, kassadin, azir (nerfed to fuck and dead), malzahar (nerfed to fuck and bad) and i am starting to pick up diana. can also play a bit of veigar and xerath. is my champ pool just bad against her or am i playing it wrong or what any tips appreciated.

since nerfs on malz and azir its really crippled my champion pull and atm leaves me playing with just velkoz and kassadin if i last pick him into a good lane.

and i get TRASHED by ahri as velkoz, my ult is a free charm, and my 3 skillshots she has 3 dashes for. kill me.

was considering trying out lb i would think she does ok into an ahri?

replies.body:
She is a skill shot champion too. Avoid them.

As a Velkoz you have equal if not better pushing power. You also have longer range poke and your W and E both go through minions.
You stand in or near minions to avoid the charm and use mechanics or positioning to avoid the Q.

Take {{summoner:3}}  for when she jumps on your face and save your E until all her dashes are down.
Avoid her post-6. Just W the wave twice, farm with Q and hug the tower.

Velkoz is like Ziggs or Orianna. Your not supposed to be 1v1'ing "assassins". You lane to farm and be a beast in teamfights.

If you really want to beat her then you need point and click burst. {{champion:134}}  or {{champion:1}}
You make tentacle drawings of ahri :3

LB used to do well against ahri but I'm not sure anymore. I find Veigar works well against Ahri since new Veigar can push back really hard and make it hard for Ahri to farm and sustain in early levels and you can 100-0 her alot earlier into the game than when she can do the same to you, making it hard for her to look for opportunities to go for the kill early. Don't try to outgank her, either stay in your lane or counter gank her since your Stun Circle is better in 2v2s and 3v3s than her charm.

 Alot of ahri's potential is in skillshots and so her positioning and how she plays the lane can be a little broadcast when her ult is down since most of ahri's power (though not damage) is tied to her ult and you should be very careful if she leaves lane whilst she has her ult as a good ahri will be able to make some very creative and effective roams. Burning Ahri's ultimate with a jungle gank is highly effective because without her ult she has to play alot safer and she won't be able to make many big plays without it. 

Another key point to remember when fighting ahri is that often when going for the kill an ahri player will fire off all her spells with her first dash, meaning if you can dodge it, she'll be vulnerable for a few seconds until her rotation of spells come back up. If an Ahri engages with her ult, she'll generally be planning on dodging your abilities with it, however, after casting her ult, there is a slight delay before she can cast it again, and this brief window is when you'll be able to nail her with all your spells.

 Other general tips is watch out for the return q damage since this damage is true damage and this will hurt alot more as you start to enter the mid and lategame. Most of her burst damage in the midgame will come from her w, whilst her bread and butter poke will always be her q and lategame her q becomes a terrifying burst spell thanks to the true damage (which becomes more painful as you begin to rely on inbuilt mr scaling or defensive items like abyssal, so i'd personally suggest buying hp or for ad midlaners the edge of night). If you stand in the middle of minions ahri's q can be hard to dodge and will also heal her more so I'd suggest standing to the side as this forces her to re-position to get a good trade off, this can also be used to force her next to a sidebush which can make her easier to gank. However if it looks like she wants to go all-in standing nearish behind minions can lower her damage potential just a bit or force her to go further in which makes it alot riskier for her. Another very very scary thing is that if an Ahri player can clip you with the very end of her q, you'll take damage 3 times. I'm still not sure if that's twice on the regular dmg or twice on the true dmg but it hurts alot more, counterbalancing this though is the fact that it's very hard to land like this and very easy to dodge, meaning if the enemy ahri is trying this, unless they're very very good, you can generally just make them miss by moving to the left or right a bit.

That's about all I can think off, I'm sure there's more but that's as far as I know, oh and Ahri's auto attack animation, whilst good, does have some latency after she's begun that orb twirl but before she launches the auto attack, so that's the best time to harass her when she's csing.

thanks for the help guys some good info here. a particular problem i have been having is: i see the matchup and decide as vel right im just going to waveclear and play it safe. then the jungler always wants to try and make big early plays usually in the enemy jungle which compels me to follow as the ahri goes to counter the play and we all endup dying in enemy jungle =( with the jungler flaming me and then continually doing the same thing over and over when all i wanted to do is farm mid

well for this you want to ward more and also take barrier/exhaust and ping the jungler not to come to your lane if you think you're going to get counterganked. Bad junglers are an issue that you can't really account for unfortunately.
I generally take barrier due to its lower cooldown unless im against yasuo etc

That is actually the worst advice. Don't play an ADC mid when you have champions like Zed and Yasuo available, who do arguably well against Ahri. Zed can essentially avoid all her poke, and retaliate either by poking her back or going in himself, and Yasuo can nullify all her poke if he times his wind wall right, and has multiple dashes himself if he positions himself right.

As previously mentioned before, champions such as Syndra and Annie do well because they can burst her down easily. I'd also imagine Cassiopeia to do quite well against her, as her Q is easily place-able if Ahri was to dash in. Cassiopeia's W also prevents Ahri from dashing in/out or flashing away which can be good should she try to escape. Also if you're quick enough, you can ult as Ahri dashes in and then proceed to burst her down with your E which resets quite fast. Ahri is easily in the top 5 strongest mid-lane picks and has been for a long long time.

Overall, your champion pool is quite weak against her. Malzahar was a really strong pick against her but as you mentioned he got nerfed. Diana can be a good pick provided you build MR first item and are able to complete your Q/Ult combo regularly and you can cancel one of her dashes too. As a Vel'Koz, you really need to predict where she's going to dash to and try and position your E there as it will cancel her dash and for a short duration incapacitate her and prevent her from doing anything. You must wait for her to use E (and hopefully miss) before turning around to ult otherwise it becomes useless. 

Ultimately as immobile mages you must play safe and avoid her post-6 otherwise you can just surrender because if she gets fed she can steamroll games and smoke all competition. She was much stronger until they nerfed her so you can be thankful for that too.

I'd argue that immobile mages like veigar, annie, syndra (much higher skill req for this matchup) and ziggs are pretty decent against ahri, just don't play adc's midlane into an assassin, it doesn't go well in any equal skill matchup. I am a stronger advocate that adc's should stay botlane and aren't meant to be played midlane into assassins (who prey on adcs).
